moves.1. e4: This is my first annotated game and one that I feel shows the importance of developing lines of attack. It is the second team game I had against this opponnet with him winning a decisive victory in only 9 moves by playing totally in a style that I wasn't use to. So at the beginning of this game I felt I had to develop a strong defence. Any comments/ views  would be appreciated!
moves.2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4: To take pawn allows white to devop better in the centre
moves.3... a6 4. dxc5 e5 5. Bc4 b5: Qa4 may have been better but again was thinking defencely
moves.6... Qxb6: Didn't want to bring queen out so early but little other options
moves.7. Qd5: White plays aggressively going for pawn f4 and possibility of destroying kingside defences.
moves.8. Qxe5+: white takes pawn on e5 controlling the centre and making me very worried!!
moves.9. b3: I think white should have played Ng5 to add further pressure?? But could also see that whites next move would be Bb2 however
moves.9... Bc5: The move allows me to open a line of attack my first chance of the game
moves.10... Nf6: This allows me to develop knight and block queens diagonal
moves.11. Nc3: White continues with development and defence of e4 pawn
moves.11... d6: The queen is bothering me and I want to move it before I castle
moves.12. Qg3: I now see a way of capturing whites queen
moves.12... Nh5: If white moves Qh3 then Ng5 will ensure queen is captured however
moves.14. Rd1: White lines up rook for possibility of later attack??
moves.14... Bb7: I now open up second diagonal of attack. Both bishops are in good positions and I am happy
moves.15... O-O-O: With whites attack strongly on kingside I now castle on queen side!!
moves.16. e5: Again I feel under pressure so attack queen
moves.16... g5: White has no other option as white queen has no where else to go so exchanges
moves.17... fxe6: I take the bishop again feel as I am in a better position as whites attack isn't well developed
moves.18. Qxg5: I feel white made a blunder here as now will allow me to open yet another line of attack which will cost him the game
moves.18... Rhg8: Rhg8 now supports attck on g2 pawn with added pressure from bishop and queen white was now in trouble
moves.19. Qxf6: Queen takes knight sacrifice and I can put my final attack together.
moves.19... Bxf2+: Checking king and hoping that white will move king to h1
moves.20... dxe5: I take pawn hoping that white will fall into the trap and take pawn on e5 with knight which he does
moves.21. Nxe5 Bxg2#: Checkmate. I suppose I got lucky in the end but still feel the game warrants annotation as it shows the importance of good lines of attack. I hope you enjoyed it.
